Package org.roxbotix.elibs2.drive

Class Swerve

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.roxbotix.elibs2.drive.Swerve
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Drive
    public class Swerve
extends java.lang.Object
implements Drive
    An updated and shorter Swerve drive mode.

    Swerve drive... isn't something that I understand very well. As a result, it's very likely that some of my math here is wrong. If it is, please feel free to correct it. I'd love to have to re-write a couple fewer lines of code.

    Although unrelated, I have to say - god, I'm not excited to write kinematics and pathfinding code for this stuff. Meccanum drive is one beast - I already understand it well enough to create a pathfinder using it. Swerve drive, however - well, that's where it starts to get a bit less fun.

    Author:
    Colin Robertson

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private Swerve4Wheel drivetrain
      The internally-used drivetrain.
      double L
      A measurement, in inches, representing each of the swerve module's distance from the center of the robot along the vertical axis.
      double R
      Use some classic Pythagorean Theorem type shit to figure out the total distance from each of the swerve modules.
      double W
      A measurement, in inches, representing each of the swerve module's distance from the center of the robot along the horizontal axis.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init​(int[] fris,
                 int[] flis,
                 int[] bris,
                 int[] blis)
        Initialize the drivetrain. I'd strongly suggest you read the rest of this JavaDoc if you'd like to have an idea as to what's going on here.

        Each of the inputted arrays should be of length FOUR - meaning there is FOUR different integers in the array. Those integers are as follows.

        • Drive motor hardware ID.
        • Turn motor hardware ID.
        • Turn motor encoder hardware ID.
        • Turn motor encoder's CPR (counts per rotation).

        Parameters:
        fris - the hardware IDs for the front-right motor. Check this JavaDoc for more information regarding this array and what it contains.
        flis - the hardware IDs for the front-left motor. Check this JavaDoc for more information regarding this array and what it contains.
        bris - the hardware IDs for the back-right motor. Check this JavaDoc for more information regarding this array and what it contains.
        blis - the hardware IDs for the back-left motor. Check this JavaDoc for more information regarding this array and what it contains.

      • drive

        public void drive​(double lsx,
                  double lsy,
                  double rsx,
                  double rsy)
        Use updated values to correct the motor power for the robot.

        In other words, drive the robot.

        Specified by:
        drive in interface Drive
        Parameters:
        lsx - LEFT STICK X.
        lsy - LEFT STICK Y.
        rsx - RIGHT STICK X.
        rsy - RIGHT STICK Y.
